author: Placida
title: Exceptional Hospital Care
body:
My relative has received exceptional care in hospital for many years. The staff have always been very caring compassionate and competent. She felt very comfortable within the environment and was made to feel part of a family. There are too many names to mention but many stand out and reception always had a smile and a kind word.  
Ward B2 also provided stand out care. All members of staff, from the nurses to the domestic staff gave fantastic care and showed great compassion. Sadly this was my relative's final stay in hospital as her condition by this time was terminal, however the staff worked very quickly to allow my relative home to palliative care. We were passed over to the Haven team with medication and pain relief supervised by the community nurses. Within hours a hospital bed was set up in the living room overlooking the garden. The speed and efficiency was truly impressive, particularly during this very difficult time. Excellent nursing care continued from all staff. Sadly I have forgotten the names as this was a traumatic time. My relative passed away peacefully and pain free in her own home, which was her wish.  
Powerful prescription medication was required to maintain comfort. After my relative passed I was asked to return the drugs to the dispensing pharmacy, as is normal practice. I attended the pharmacy but was informed that during the covid crisis they were no longer accepting the unused drugs. I contacted the community nurses who informed me a couple of days later that they would now accept the drugs. I again visited the pharmacy only to be informed that they would not accept unused drugs under any circumstances. I updated the community nurses to my situation.  
I'm certain that this goes against policy on the handling and disposal of schedule one prescription drugs. I'm sure we will not be alone in this situation and feel there is an increased risk to vulnerable grieving individuals, it also puts young children at risk and could even provide an opportunity for illicit drug abuse.  
I think that this is a highly unsatisfactory situation to which a solution must be found. We are still in possession of these drugs and need advice. I do not hold any of the excellent nursing staff responsible for this, it is clearly a management issue. I think there has been some discussion, but sadly no solution.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: Happy Patient 27
title: E-Consultation
body: I completed an E consultation online late one night for an ongoing yet minor issue with my ear. I was called the following day by a very lovely Dr Saraf. Unfortunately as I was at work I missed the first call. He left a very polite message. I then received a text message for me to send a picture of my ear. He promptly rang back. He was very polite and friendly and quickly arranged for some cream to be sent via my pharmacy (he had also offered to have the prescription available for me to pick up if it was my preference) I honestly can not praise this system and Northumberland Park Medical staff more as during times when our NHS is trying to avoid as much contact as possible this for me was the perfect solution. Reception/Admin staff also always go above and beyond to help. Thank you all for your support during these tricky times. Always 5* üëçüèº

author: Lois071
title: Too much alcohol - advised to get help
body: I drink too much alcohol. I was advised to get help through inclusion. I received very good care and felt helped and involved

title: Fantastic Hospital
body:
Ripley minor injuries unit is a credit to the NHS. I suffered a mallet finger injury during the lockdown and wasn't sure if I should go to hospital so phoned Ripley Hospital. The nurse I spoke to on the phone was lovely and reassured me that it was something that needed to be seen. I went in and was greeted by a lovely man who took my temperature and asked me questions about coronavirus symptoms. The safety measures put in place because of coronavirus were excellent and I felt at ease being there.
I can't praise the staff highly enough from reception to medical staff they maintain professionalism while being extremely friendly and approachable. It must be hard for them working in PPE but they are still cheerful and friendly. The care I received was top class. The hospital is clean and well organised and the staff are an absolute credit to NHS.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

author: sala
title: My husbands alcohol dependancy
body:
Controlling, fearful, watchful, critical, strined, restricted.  
I felt totally supported by ORB, but the staff workload was too much and the premises feel second class

title: Efficient practice
body: Have been using online firm of late to get advice from GP. It works well and have always had call back. Also I see nurses every 8 weeks for B12 injections this also works well.

title: Absolutely flawless
body:
I was wary at first, but really enjoyed it. My room was cosy & spotless, the staff were so kind and I was treated like a princess. 
Love to all.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

title: Completely changed my experience
body:
I was called today by a doctor/consultant in the pain team and she couldn't have been more professional. She was fully versed with my case and had obviously spent some time reading my notes and studying scans before calling. She answered all of my questions without hesitation and gave across an air of confidence that I found to be very reassuring.

Before Covid, I had been seen by a pain consultant who awful. But this phone call has really restored my trust in North Mid. I can only hope that everyone has an equally positive experience!

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Phone call from GP (during covid lockdown)
body:
A doctor called within the time slot given (9.30 to 12.30) around 10, she had reviewed my notes for the last few years and the hospital referrals. When I spoke about my current symptoms she was able to give me some very helpful suggestions and told be to look out for other symptoms and to call back if I needed to.

She was very clear about what could and could not happen at this time and what resources were available.

title: Great help
body:
Today I ran the surgery at 5.30 and spoke to a very helpful receptionist. She took my details and the problem. Within 5minutes a Gp rang me back and advised a prescription. From the time I rang to picking my prescription up from very helpful staff at Bure Park was 25 minutes. 

Thank you to everyone !!!

title: Wonderful phlebotomists
body: In spite of being nervous because of the pandemic, I was treated with excellent care when I came for a blood test this morning (14.5.2020). Many thanks to the phlebotomy team. It was a pity that another patient was being obnoxious but impressive how the phlebotomist responded with professionalism. Many thanks.

title: Online consultation brilliant
body: I went into the beacon group online consultation in the Monday and Tuesday the doctor phone me and sorted my issue and been referred to a specialist. Great response. Thankyou

title: Efficient and caring
body: Spoke with the Doctor, within minutes I had an appointment for a scan and later for a blood test the next day. Very efficient service, cannot fault it! Pleased with the friendliness and thoroughness of the doctor.

title: always listen and try to help
body: It was a telephone consultation due to current covid limitations. My doctor explained a hospital response she had received by letter and asked how I wished to proceed. I asked for the options and likely outcomes and I decided the way forward. I felt she was supportive and gave me the time to talk and ask questions. Very helpful.

title: Trusted Carers
body: I found intercounty very reliable in looking after my 88 year old sister for 9 months prior to her going into a care home. Nothing was to much trouble for any of the staff. Highly recommend safe hands.

title: Wonderful practice
body: I have been a patient at this practice for nearly 30 years,my family also go there and I cannot speak highly enough of the care ,efficiency and treatment I have received. This week, I was able to email, send an image of an infected arm, due to a wasp sting. Doctor rang back promptly and send prescription to local pharmacy for collection. An amazingly efficient service. Thank you.

title: Best practice I‚Äôve been registered with.
body:
After some really negative experiences at another practice I‚Äôve always been reluctant to contact my GP and avoid it at all costs.
 
I‚Äôve recently had a few silly health concerns and after stressing for a few days, reading too much google and generally getting more and more distressed I gave in and completed an online request. 

I was called back the same day and I‚Äôve never had such a friendly and helpful Dr on the other end of the phone. Completely understood my concerns, talked everything through with me and completely put me at ease. 

A few weeks later and worried my symptoms had changed, I called the surgery directly after being advised to by the online form. I was worried I‚Äôd be seen as just wasting time especially through the Covid-19 pandemic but I was starting to worry myself about the symptoms I had. 
The person that answered the phone was again very friendly and understanding, listened to my concerns, found the Dr I‚Äôd spoken to previously and arranged a call back really quickly. I was called back within an hour by the same friendly Dr I‚Äôd spoken to the first time and just having that continuity really helped me feel at ease, another thorough discussion of my new symptoms and concerns dispelled any worry with my health and the Dr was very reassuring that It was ok to call for advice if I was concerned. 

Just having that reassurance has helped with my condition as it is very much stress related and having an understanding medical professional talk it through with me makes it all feel like there are better days ahead! 

On top of some other really positive experiences previously I‚Äôd happily recommend this surgery to anyone!

title: Very efficient
body:
Prompt reply to e consult - X-ray within a week - and personal call back by GP with the result and next step advice. 
Excellent service with friendly staff.

title: Great care
body: Taken in to hospital with chest pains early hours of the morning. As soon as I arrived they took me straight to cardiology, Where they diagnosed me with a blocked artery which led to a heart attack, and unblocked my artery all before 9 am. After care for the next 3 days in hospital was incredible, even during the on going threat of coronavirus. Fantastic team at the cardiology department.,and I am so grateful for what they done for me.

title: Brilliant Practice
body: The staff, the ones at the reception, the nurses, the pharmacists and the doctors are wonderful. I found them  very helpful and good practice.

title: First Rate Service
body: I developed symptoms I was worried about and used the online system from which my GP rang me back for a phone consultation. From that call I was asked to visit my GP at the surgery and was informed about all the extra measures that they had implemented for Covid-19 so that I was not worried when I arrived. Everyone was friendly and having not visited a doctor's personally for over 10 years my GP was reassuring and listened to my answers. I needed to come back a week later for further tests and this was handled swiftly and I really like the reminders that are texted to you so that you have a reminder. I can best summarise my experience as arriving worried about my symptoms and leaving the practice reassured that I visited and was getting the right treatment

title: RELAXING ATMOSPHERE & PROFESSIONAL
body:
My first time to University Hospital Coventry Renal department. Right from the front entrance to meeting my specialist all the staff were so friendly and highly professional I felt I was visiting old friends.
The hospital was immaculate and the information available to find the correct way to different departments was first class.
i thought the visit would be stressful, it wasn't, thanks for that.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Great response and very helpful
body: Had a call from Doctor who was very professional and helpful‚Äô I have been referred for an MRI scan and am told that there may be treatments available!

title: Fantastic practice
body:
Always supported by the wonderful team members in this practice, from reception, to nursing and medical staff. 
They have worked tirelessly to keep services running throughout the COVID19 crisis and we feel very safe and protected by this practice.
In particular I received amazing care in my pregnancy last year, and then subsequently the effort the team have gone to to review my baby daughter and ensure she is thriving during the pandemic has far exceeded expectations. They returned my calls quickly and discussed my concerns with compassion, and I noticed this care continue when I attended in person for her vaccinations. I am incredibly grateful to the staff. 
I believe this practice functions very well, with appointments and consultations easy to access as required. I also feel the staff clearly work well together in supporting their patients and for this I am incredibly grateful.
I can not recommend this practice enough.

title: Downhill Service
body: Since the Medical Centre was taken over by the Beacon Medical Group I feel that the service has degraded to the point that I seriously thought of changing to another practice. It has become very impersonation with the preferred form of interaction with a member of the medical team in the form of a Telephone call or filling in form on line, this would not be at all possible if it were an older member of my family. I‚Äôm surprised that If it were that easy to perform an in-depth consultation with a patient that it‚Äôs not been tried before and all that training that Doctors have is it to much. I prefer to see a Doctor and don‚Äôt know of any other public service that gets to set its own agenda???? Without public approval??.

title: Thank - you
body: We would just like to thank all the staff involved in helping my husband, Colin, to recover from his recent case of pneumonia, asthma, & the coronavirus...he was very poorly but was one of your successes...we really appreciate all the care he was given so that he pulled through inspite of all his other health issues...thank-you very much....

title: Rude male Doctor
body: Honestly rude doctors and helpful receptionists. Sometimes doctors believe to be gods, I am afraid that is not the case. Today I spoken with a male doctor and clearly wanted to close down the call as soon as possible. Very disappointed

title: Very rude receptionist
body: Receptionist I spoke to was very unprofessional..very rude tone an zero people skills . Made me never want to make a appointment again . Defently should not be working within NHS .

title: Covid19
body: Amazing service being provided by the team in this pandemic, hats off to the reception team, clinical team and the manager keeping things in line.

title: Excellent Service
body: Staff have been very helpful during this difficult time. I am finding the new eConsult service very quick and easy to use! It's great that I no longer have to ring up to get an appointment.

title: Frustrated
body: I ordered psc for HRT was given a 3 month psc, but only received  1 month supply by Asda pharmacy as that‚Äôs all they had in stock. They were unable to get another supply so pharmacist recommended I get another psc. I rang the surgery and explained all of this and ordered another psc, and was told it would be available from 3pm on the 14th. When I went to collect my psc on the 15th it wasn‚Äôt there. Rang GP they wouldn‚Äôt send it as they said it wasn‚Äôt due because they had given me a 3 month supply. I said I knew this but the pharmacy only had 1 month to give me and I had explained all of this when it was ordered. I was informed it could be ordered but as HRT was not an emergency the psc could not be sent out until Monday 18th. I had spent quite a while ringing around to find my HRT and managed to find some in Sainsburys where they kindly offered to keep this for me until midday on the 15th. The poor communication within the practice means I may not be able to access my medication, and while you have a dismissive approach to HRT it helps me enormously.

title: For staff in the Ultrasound and XRay department -‚Ä¶
body:
My dad recently visited yourselves for an ultrasound on his kidneys and an x-ray.  
He was blown away by the service and kindness of the staff.
He was sent straight down for his scans without needing to wait, the staff were friendly and reassuring as he was quite nervous.

Staff went out of their way to support him throughout his visit.  I am extremely grateful for the care you provided my dad and my dad is extremely thankful and you all deserve to know that you are doing an amazing job!

title: Thank you
body:
I would like to say thank you to everyone at the practice for the brilliant service I have always received. I have always been seen very quickly and last Saturday within in a few hours of phoning.  
Very professional and reassuring.

author: Blanchette
title: Told that I should not be in A&E
body: I phoned my Doctor about a knee injury and because of the current circumstances, Covid-19 I was told to visit the A&E department at the Ayr Hospital. After reception I was called through by the on duty staff nurse(triage) I proceeded to tell them about my injury and was told that I should not be in A&E that I should have been seen by my Doctor. They then proceeded to call my surgery to speak to my Doctor. The nurse seemed to be more concerned with the fact that I had been sent to A&E, rather than my condition! I repeated that I was in pain with my knee and only then said they would see if they could get a Doctor to attend! I returned to the waiting room and their parting comment, was my Doctor was very naughty!!! I then well looked after by one of the Doctors.

title: extremely pleased
body: I contacted them via the econsult service which is really efficient they got back to me the 1st thing the next day and called me in for an appointment everything was well run and the protocols put in place were adhered to strongly by the members of staff that I saw I got promt information and left with a sense of relief that they had looked after me while I was there  under these challenging circumstances

author: madperson
title: A&E treatment
body:
Last weekend I was struggling with my mental health and unfortunately self harmed and had to attend A&E  
I am currently shielding so it was a difficult decision to go to the hospital but I know that I needed some help  
When I booked in at reception I felt very judged and the person taking my details rolled her eyes and said to someone else ‚Äòself harm!‚Äô  
I was quickly taken to another area and put in a cubicle that only had curtains between them.  
The first nurse that I saw was very understanding and talked to me and even made me a cup of tea which was really nice. They seemed to understand what I was going through  
Then the doctor came and looked at the wound and said it could be steri stripped but I explained that I was allergic to them. They said that they would get the theatre nurse to come and have a look. I was surprised that this doctor was not wearing any PPE  
A person came from DPM and made a statement as they walked in that they had seen me before. They sat down and asked me what had happened. I tried to explain that the cubicle was not very private and I had heard full details of other patients ailments so was reluctant to explain what had happened  
This staff member flippantly replied that the doctor was not going to treat my wound and I was to leave. They walked out  
I waited for another hour but no one came so I just left. My wound was open and bleeding. I was very suicidal and stood by the river instead of going home  
The crisis team calmed me down and made sure I got home safely  
I have spoken to a manager at DPM who is looking into this for me  
However I had to wait until the next day when the District Nurses cleaned my wound and pulled it together  
Today I am really unwell. My wound is badly infected and I have a temperature. My GP has just given me some antibiotics  
If the staff at A&E had cleaned my wound and dressed it then I feel that I would not be so poorly now.  
They showed no care for my well-being  
The wound is red and swollen with the redness tracking from the wound and I am concerned that I could get sepsis as I have had this in the past  
I want to know why my wound wasn‚Äôt cleaned and why the doctor told the DPM professional to send me home  
In the future I am unlikely to go to A&E for support when I am struggling or when I have hurt myself  
My psychiatric team are visiting me daily and have been amazing

title: Misinformation
body:
Have been coming to this surgery for almost 30 years. It has always been good, however it has massively deteriorated in the past few years. I now have a 7 month old son, I called yesterday to make an appt and was surprised to get a pre-booked one for the following morning as pre-booked appts have not previously been available. The receptionist confirmed the appt was 9.40am, and I advised what it was concerning. Shortly after arriving at the surgery an member of staff advised it was actually a telephone consultation at 3.40. At this very moment a text message arrived with an appt reminder for 3.40. (funny as the staff were frantically tapping away on their comps!)Not once did the receptionist advise it was a telephone appt, nor did she advise the appt was 3.40 even when I confirmed the time of 9.40 with her on the phone. The surgery was empty, and I was the only patient waiting for the 40 mins I waited and still wasn't able to see a doctor even though I was there with my son.
In these difficult times I only wish to bring my baby son for an absolute essential reason. 
Very disappointed in the service of the surgery in these past years, and I will be changing as I imagine many other long standing patients will also. 
I understand mistakes happen, however this isn't the first time.

title: Repeat prescription nightmare
body:
April 2020: Repeat prescription ordered at chemist -14 days later it finally arrives = wrong medication.(I saw the script it was wrong) I checked before taking it home. Girl in the pharmacy reordered.

End of April - ordered from chemist. Partner collected - wrong medication again (had to phone surgery who said it had been ordered wrong) collected 2 days later

May: ordered - 3 days later went to pharmacy given correct medication from end of April??? nothing from latest script. (Was shown print out showing it had been ordered). Telephoned surgery nothing has been ordered.

This medication is for a diabetic and is what has happened during the past 2 months. Earlier in the year the wrong insulin was issued. It is so important that you get this medication right!

title: A shame
body: Having been registered here for 12 years, on moving house only 5 minutes away from our previous address, I've now been told we need to find another surgery, although we are unable to find one nearer to us that is taking on patients. The surgery has the ability to keep our family as patients but has refused for reasons unknown. This now leaves us with no GP care and during the current pandemic is incredibly heartless and puts us under unnecessary stress. A shame as before now we found our care with Underwood surgery to be generally quite good, although appointments have always been difficult to get.

title: Amazing service
body: I have had dealings with both of the n advanced nurse ractitioners over the last few months, once in the surgery and three times over the phone as my asthma was uncontrolled.  On each occasion I received gret advice, I felt fully understood and listened to and in recent times when I worried I was wasting time as I ddn't have COVID-19 I was made to feel looked after and the nurses have listened to be and been so lovely and caring.  Thank you!!!

title: A considerate member of staff
body:
We have always received great service from a considerate member of staff (I am not allowed to leave a name here). She is always thoroughly professional, very helpful and caring. It's always a pleasure to speak to her because I know she will deal promptly with needs.

I wish all the staff at the surgery my best wishes during this very difficult time. Please take care all.

title: Fantastic Support
body: I would like to thank all the staff for all the brilliant care and professionalism I received during the whole process.  Extremely clean and the staff were so kind and explained the whole appointment in a clear and understanding way from start to finish.  Wonderful and lovely experience.  Thank You so much and will recommend to all I know with a 11/10 all the time.

title: Friendly and professional staff
body:
I am very grateful for the service provided today. From ringing and speaking to a very friendly receptionist, to having an appointment with the doctor, I can say that I received very caring and professional care. The doctor was able to address my concerns and create and appointment in between his already busy schedule. With the NHS under so much pressure with regards to Covid 19, I am extremely grateful for the care and reassurance I received today.

Thankyou

author: Amanda McC
title: Amazing midwives Ward 24
body: I had a miscarriage at 14 weeks and had to go into hospital to deliver baby. Kirsteen, Jane and Gillian were incredible. They helped us through a really traumatic time and the care and compassion given to us was amazing. I cannot thank them enough for what they done for us. Amazing ladies.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: perseusmt73
title: Fast tracked into coronary
body:
I was fast tracked into coronary as I'd had racing heart beat for period of time.  
I was met the moment I entered front doors by various staff who had a smile, a aura of calmness and confidence in their specialist fields.They effortlessly calmed me down within minutes and gave me a confidence that I was in professional safe hands.  
Over the course of 5 hours, I was regularly checked for temp, heart tracing, blood pressure, given chest x Ray, bloods taken and analysed and even given a choice of meal with cup of tea.  
As my heart was beating so fast, the sen consultant decided on an injection (Adenosine!) and he prepared me for the short discomfort I‚Äôd feel when administered. All was ok.  
It‚Äôs been said by numerous people that nursing (all levels in the medical field) is a vocation by people whose sole delight is in helping others. This can never be challenged ... ever. They are all our angels on this earth.  
Thank you all.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: feeling of care
body: i was secure in the feeling of being looked after by excellent staff in day theatres i never imagined what these people do on a daily basis no matter who you are or where you are from

readBy.name: Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Difficulty with Doctor, however the Manager‚Ä¶
body: It took a very long time to get an appointment with the doctor and when I finally did it wasn't a pleasant experience. The doctor was unprofessional and rude and left us feeling pretty disappointed. We call the doctor because we have genuine concerns about the situation we are dealing with and to be faced with that was hard and left me no other option to take the matter to higher management. The manager was actually of great help, he understood the situation and made sure things were resolved. HAts off to the manager and even though he is new he helped straight away, shame it had to get that far for a genuine problem to be solved, something you would think the doctors would have been able to do. The manager has said he will make improvement to the service of staff and the way patients are treated and looked after. Hope this is the case.

title: Lovely service
body:
I telephoned the surgery this morning and was greeted by a polite, friendly and reassuring receptionist who informed me that a clinician would call me back.
When I recieved the call back, the clinician was very thorough in their questionning, easy to talk to and took the time to listen.  I did not want to phone and take up their time but with an ongoing condition, I needed to.  The clinician reassured me that I had done the right thing and was very kind and respectful in their manner towards me throughout the whole contact.  This experience was very positve, particularly when I was feeling a bit anxious about contacting the GP surgery and the clinician I spoke to is definitely an asset to them.

title: prescription ordering
body:
I called up in the morning to ask about a prescription that I needed and the service I got was fabulous my doctor was not there to approve so the duty doctor signed for it and sent to the pharmacy and within a short time the whole thing was done as usually the pharmacy takes time but the efficiency of the surgery was so good and it seems to always be the case I have only been with the surgery a year and am so happy so far so good and in my condition to me it is important it might seem so trivial to somebody else but care is important.
Thank you once again for your help
Anna Hackett

author: NKD
title: Superb treatment under exceptional circumstances
body:
I really didn‚Äôt want to go to hospital, like many other individuals I was worried that I may contract COVID 19 and I did not want to put the NHS under unnecessary strain. In addition my wife has a very rare life limiting illness called LAM which meant catching COVID 19 could be fatal. She had been shielding for the last eight weeks and I really was very frightened for her health.  
However I had no choice when about 1030pm one Wednesday I slipped whilst putting out the recycling. I put my arm out to break my fall which it did, but in the process I injured it badly. I knew immediately that I had either broken or dislocated it. The pain was excruciating.  
My first thought was to get my wife to take me to hospital but this would potentially undo the last eight weeks shielding and in any case I could not get myself off the floor, so she called for an ambulance.  
It is fair to say that from the paramedics at the outset of my treatment to the nurses, sister, doctors, orthopaedic specialist, radiologist and the staff disinfecting and cleaning the rooms I was in, the care, compassion and treatment was second to none.  
The paramedics like all the staff I came into contact with were wearing various levels of PPE appropriate to their role. However even through the masks their concern for me penetrated the PPE and was conveyed in the tone of their voices.  
Because I had a rota cuff tear repaired 12 months ago to my now injured shoulder the A&E Doctor woke up the on call orthopaedic specialist. I had a nasty dislocation which required me to be sedated to put back in place.  
Because the staff did not want my wife to pick me up when I was ready for discharge they arranged for a taxi at the hospitals expense.  
I did not get any names of the staff due to being in so much pain, I do know the Ambulance crew came from Ilfracombe to take me to North Devon District Hospital, Barnstaple and the A&E team were the night shift on Wednesday.  
They are just a few of our wonderful NHS who are sacrificing their family life as the sister who was living away from her family to protect her son who had cystic fibrosis are doing. Some are also paying the ultimate price, with the loss of their lives to treat and care for us.  
I want to thank everyone who I came into contact with during my treatment. Keep safe.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous caring , dedicated GP i have.
body: Have been a patient of this practice for 20 or so years , same GP now for past 18 years , he is incredible. Gives time and is very thorough in all his reviews and examinations. Tremendously grateful and thankful for him. Reception staff are all very patient and happy to engage in a chat and are super helpful. Be kind and you get kindness back.

title: Very satisfied with overall experience
body: Very satisfied with the overall experience with my recent online consultation. I'm glad I had my wife to help me with the eConsult service as I'd have found it difficult to do on my own. I was very happy to have received a fast response and to get the treatment I needed- can't fault it.

title: thorough and therapeutic
body:
I had a telephone memory assessment which both helped me to express my concerns about my short term memory and made me feel understood. I have since received a written account of our exchange which accurately reflected the interview.
I would strongly recommend this service.

author: Dorothy 89
title: Lovely accident and emergency doctor
body:
I attended the Croydon accident and emergency department last week and had agreat experience with the fantastic doctor ted. He was professional, kind and very funny. he had a great way of making me feel at ease and held my hand throughout procedures that took place. I want to pass on my thanks to ted in particular for his tenderness, charm and friendliness throughout our time together, I would recommend him to others.  
FANTASTIC DOCTER

author: NORMAN S
title: my therapist
body: I just want to say how wonderful, kind & helpful my therapist John was, hes a truly superb man!

author: Hy
title: Sau ward 11
body:
I was taken to sau ward last week with servere abdominal pain the doctors did a ct scan which they said came back clear later I found out on my discharge notes I had cysts on my ovaries  
The doctors couldn't find out what the pain was and refused to do anymore tests I left a few days later still in pain  
Yesterday I ended back up on the sau hardly able to walk in so much pain I had alot of urine in my blood I tried to explain I could have endometriosis and needed to see a gynecologist they refused and sent me home still with serve pain the nurses where shocked I was being sent home the doctors and consultants didnt listen to me they talked over me and dont seem to like me asking for more tests or to see someone else I am now stuck in bed on codeine with blood still coming out in my urine scared and in pain as no one will help me they are putting my health at risk and they dont show any signs of caring  
Nurses and healthcare professionals where amazing in sau just the doctors and consultants didnt care

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
I had to take my daughter to A&E yesterday after she collapsed.  She was seen quickly and everything that the doctor and nurses did for her was carefully explained - she has learning difficulties.
She was treated with respect and consideration, and the nurses and the doctor who saw her were wonderful.
Thank you so much for making a really traumatic incident bearable for the both of us.

title: Fantastic new secretary
body:
Contacted my partners neurologists new secretary and the response was very quick and the issue was dealt with perfectly. I believe she is a new member of Salford royals neurology team and she handled the question so promptly and professionally. Definitely the best way to get in touch with a member of your care team especially as the phone lines are very confusing at the moment due to COVID and the secretary‚Äôs are working from home. 
Can not fault the recent service from this department, everything has been fast and efficient to aid in my partner in getting his driving license back!

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

author: Staff on the receiving end
title: I was a patient in my own hospital where i work
body:
Im a staff nurse at FVRH. After developing a migraine with arm pain mid shift a porter was asked to take me to a&e. That is the last I remember on the Thursday. I woke up on Saturday in ITU. I had seizurez and had to be vented due to low sat02.  
At home now after discovering an aneurysm on my brain. Every staff member are amazing. I was in 3 wards in total and everyone treated me respectfully, kindly, safely. Some staff I knew but others were strangers. Now waiting fir the neurosurgery team to review my scans and decide a plan of action. What an amazing team we r at firth Valley royal hospital. Thank you for looking after one of your own. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüç∞üç∞

readBy.name: Office of Angus MacDonald, MSP for Falkirk East

title: Treatment and staff are great but communication‚Ä¶
body:
Being under the care of BRI dermatology for just over a year, the doctors are great and very knowledgeable but its severely let down by their poor communication.

Twice over the past year I've been told I need to call the dermatology nurse or department to discuss symptoms or medication, most recently during this pandemic they wanted to up my medication after speaking with my GP I was told to call the department just was just transferred round the hospital until finally put though to a voice mail that told me NOT to leave a message and to call the original number I called if it was urgent. Totally useless. On top of that I received no letter advising me I was vulnerable to the coronavirus despite the fact I was on immunosuppressants and a family member of mine being seen by weston hospital dermatology had been sent one by them for the same medication.

I understand the pressure they are under and that why I would still recommend them but they need to improve communication before something serious happens how are patients to know what to do if they had issues with medication if they cant speak to anyone especially as we are told we have to stay home so can attend the hospital in person.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)
University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful service
body:
I had a evaluation over the phone due to Corona Virus. The man I spoke to was quite pleasant. I was told to call anytime.
So I did, when I was struggling and very low. Phone call I made day one. A man answered with a sigh, I said it appears he would rather be anywhere else, he replied " yeah of course, I'm at work". I was flabbergasted. I felt deflated, dismissed, let down,worthless ,like I did not matter. Then he half heartedly put me on a list for a pals service. I called again the next day, this time a lady, she was Kurt, cold, dismissive, she asked me in an awful manner what was it I wanted, she then told me to be happy, I laughed nervously, she threatened to end the conversation because I laughed. I laughed because she told me to be happy... does she have any idea how awful it is to say that to someone in lockdown having just left a psychiatric unit, who is struggling everyday to hold herself together with no help from anyone. They don't know what to say beacause they tell me to meditate and practices mindfulness, I do. They suggest exercise, I do. Get a routine, I have. That's all they have. I'm trying so hard to do all this and keep myself together. When I can't I reach out, to be made to feel worthless, insignificant, difficult, inconvenient. It's heartbreaking to be made to feel like this by people in a position of trust, by people where it's there job to help vulnerable people. I just feel lost, sad, deflated, alone and worthless. Thank you biggleswade Mental health/ Springfield house.

title: Great service
body:
Always polite courteous & efficient
Dependable & reliable
Responsive to needs
Available without undue delay

title: Waste of time
body: I drove for the best part of an hour to reach the hospital, to have some moles looked at and potentially removed. My GP told me that I should expect to be in the hospital for over an hour, and the nurse in the department similarly said that the doctor is very thorough and I would be in there for a while. When I received a letter about my appointment it said that I should prepare to be there for up to 4 hours. Hence I prepared myself to be there until the evening. The waiting room was completely empty besides me. The doctor walked in and asked to view the moles, which he did, and then told me ‚Äòthey‚Äôre fine, you can go‚Äô. When I told him that the moles rub on my clothes and bleed, so I had been told before it would be possible to have them removed, he said that I would have to do this privately and that I should go home. Overall I spent 3 minutes in the room. I did not feel as though I was taken seriously, and although I am aware that benign moles cannot be removed on the NHS, they are harmful to me as they bleed on my clothes, and they are painful to touch. I was unhappy with the way the Doctor rushed me, and didn‚Äôt listen to my concerns, even though there was nobody else to see in the waiting room. His bedside manner was discomforting and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend taking the time to visit this dermatology department.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)
Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Excellent service and communication
body: Thank you so much to the surgery and Wellbeing Pharmacy for organising delivery of my medication today  - something I hadn‚Äôt expected. Additionally, the communication from the surgery during this crisis has been clear and informative, particularly the newsletter. I am so grateful for all they are doing to keep us safe.

title: fantastic health care
body: would just like to say how great lakeside doctors and all staff are. the excellent care my husband and myself are receiving and always have received. while this virus it upon us they are still trying to look after all the patients. my husband and myself are shielded but we cannot say that we are not being looked after. we have had to call the surgery on a few occasions through this lockdown and we are amazed at how well the receptionist etc have helped us. they answer the phone politely and are so caring, when we ask for our doctor to call us back they ask us for the reason, when we tell them the reason they reply they will get doctor to call us back that day. most times doctor calls us within a hour. doctor is so attentive and trying their best in this difficult time. just would like to say a big thank you

title: Great service
body:
Your ticket::
I was worried about a scab being skin cancer I rang the doctors and sent a picture of , they ring me in the afternoon and asked me to see her latter that day.she referred me to Basildon hospital who rang me today to arrange a telephone appointment on Monday.. I cannot believe how efficiently this has been handled thankyou to everyone

title: Amazing care
body: This week I had emergency surgery to remove my gallbladder. The staff in A & E absolutely amazing. The surgical team & the fantastic nurses on ward F8 were nothing beyond outstanding.  The pressure on the NHS currently is so much more than anyone should be dealing with but their professional & exemplary care meant that my experience was made so so much easier. I have been ill for months & had already received constant support from the SACRU team currently on F11 again absolutely outstanding & without their care & advice I dont know how I would of managed the last 2 months. I will never forget the kindness and care I received.  A huge huge thank you!

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)

title: Highly proficient service
body: My issue was quickly and efficiently resolved, a medicine I was not due to have, but required it as soon as possible, was sent to the pharmacy and dispensed with no chasing up and no delay

title: My recent experience.
body:
I don‚Äôt usually moan about a GP, but when it comes to supporting your mothers health, I don‚Äôt know where else to turn.

On 07/05/2020 I contacted the 111 to report health issues my mum was facing. The 111 advised to inform my GP of an assessment they would receive following the call. So that‚Äôs what I did, I called up and informed Grove Surgery. The lady who I spoke to advised that the doctors have gone home and I should call back for a phone consultation on Monday. Bear in mind the surgery hours is till 8:30pm and it‚Äôs a Thursday. So the person I spoke to probably thought it was Friday. 

I‚Äôve recently signed up to Pharmacy2U for my mums repeat prescription as the local pharmacy is far. I‚Äôve ordered a repeat prescription on two occasions, on both occasions Pharmacy2U have advised that they have sent the prescription request but there is no response from the GP surgery. They therefore advised me to contact the GP to authorise my mothers repeat prescription. Unfortunately, every time I call the surgery, there is no response. On the first occasion I thought I ordered the prescription  to early, so I can understand why no one responded.

My mother is 62 years old and suffers from arthritis, high blood pressure and diabetes. She also recently returned from a minor heart attack. As I manage her medical supplies, she has two weeks of supply left of specific medication. As this pandemic is causing issues with delivery etc, I want to ensure my mum does not run out of her meds. Unfortunately, I feel as if the GP surgery does not care about its vulnerable patients.

author: Neurotic mother
title: Child‚Äôs operations
body:
My son broke his elbow and required an operation to have wires placed in it. As a mother hearing your child requires an operation at any given time can be very distressing to hear. Never mind during these very unprecedented times. However I was soon put at ease as was more importantly my six year old son from the surgeons and his team the amazing nurses in ward 1a to the fabulous domestic staff. I must mention Alana and I think her name is Lorna whom first attended to my son in A and E  
They were absolutely amazing with him and really put him at ease. I cannot thank all involved in my sons treatment enough.Our wonderful nhs staff are working under extremely difficult circumstances at the moment but their kindness compassion and professionalism shines through.

author: Mhar
title: My son
body:
My 5 week old twin son was admitted to hospital through AnE for a hernia and had surgery 36 hours later. I was not only very anxious about him but also about leaving his twin sister at home with her dad. The staff were all brilliant, looking after both of us so well and finding ways to get us safely home as quick as possible. Nothing was too much hassle and we were made to feel like we were the most important patients to them. I can‚Äôt thank them all enough.  
In particular, on the night he was admitted I hadn‚Äôt eaten or drank anything since lunchtime and was breastfeeding. I mentioned this to Liz one of the Auxiliary‚Äôs who instantly arrived with the biggest plate of toast, biscuits, juice and tea... offer to give me two teas at once! She couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful, genuinely cared and made a stressful time that little bit easier. It‚Äôs the little things that make a huge difference at the time.

title: Great practice
body: I would highly recommend cuckoo lane surgery. Very professional and very caring team, I was put at ease today for a blood test, I was very impressed by the nurse associates care and excellent time keeping, I did not have to wait around.

author: ariesff37
title: I don‚Äôt really have a story
body:
Iv had mental health issues since 2012 Iv had 2 sectionings  
I don‚Äôt really have a story to tell as my mental health been that complex I be here all day  
What I do want to say is if it was not for the mental health teams Home treatment/ case management coummunity teams NORTH Northfields I would not be where I am now my last sectioning was 2016 I don‚Äôt take medication for schizoaffective disorder I manage my own mental health with the input of the teams Iv mentioned depending on my mental health state as n when I need them  
I can give nothing but praise to the teams they have worked with me over the years and gave me every bit of support I needed they are so respectful and they allow me to plan my own treatment n support me in what I request from them as n when I need them  
I can‚Äôt thank what I get n the services I get as n when I need them as on a number of occasions I could of ended up back down the road of sectioning  
I know this is not a story but I want people to to see there is light there is ways to fully recover n live a normal life and there is the support you need if you work with the nhs Sheffield nhs mental health teams the community nurse and inpatient nurses are absolutely amazing and they are the once I mainly respect more off they don‚Äôt get enough credit for what they do n this story is hopefully for the nurses and patients to know there is positive out comes from the prospective of a mental health nurses view and on the patient side of it there is a light if you can believe you can beat mental health n over come the struggles it takes to get there don‚Äôt let your head defy you  
Thanks

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Weejonnieboy
title: My Mother
body:
My Mother was admitted to ward 51.  
Unfortunately due to this coronavirus my family and myself were unable to visit, which is no fault of the ward staff. The nurses were good at phoning myself to keep me up to date and arranging a safe discharge for my mum, even arranged a facetime.  
When my mum came home she was positive about the ward staff, especially an Auxiliary call Annette and a cleaner called Jackie. Massive thanks to ward 51..

author: Vin
title: Mental health and drug and alcohol misuse
body:
I'm a 46 year old lady with a long history of psychosis brought on by drugs.. my first episode being in 1996.. it took four months to come out of and I was sectioned under the mental health act .. I was fully supported and looked after .. they also said I suffered with borderline personality disorder now known eupd ..I have a long history of self harm .. and alcohol bingeing.. as well as a amphetamine addiction .. aswell as using other substances lsd being one of them back in the 90s .  
Which caused the psychosis.. so in my twenties ,thirties, and fourtys I've still been battling this illness . And disease .. I have been under psychiatrists , cpn , mind , cgl , and other drug and alcohol services.. before it changed to cgl .  
Cgl are very supportive and up until late I was volunteering as a peer mentor.. but sadly I relapsed.  
And I had psychosis again.. cgl took me back on as a service user. Very quickly . Which is brilliant as I have no other support for my mental health .. .I had all the support I needed .. also sun network helps too ..  
. I'm under a key worker at cgl and they ring me twice a week and I can access zoom meetings .. I would like to thank all the services involved at this difficult time.. there is much more to say .. but I just leave it there .

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Sick-guy
title: Inconsiderate neighbours
body:
Had stage 4 cancer op last year and three months of chemo...ended up with dangerous blood pressure,abnormal cholesterol and diabetes type 2...still undergoing tests for ill health and liver problems!  
Neighbours knew of my circumstances and things were OK.....slowly recovering!Over 5 weeks ago they had a smokey bbq(not a problem in itself!)but were isolating in back bedroom,asleep with windows open...  
Awoke to find room covered in smoke and soon after started coughing profusely..Was awake all night and contacted 111 in morning as struggling to breathe properly!  
Now fast forward to last week..by this time I were admitted a total of 4 times to hospital and surgeries,trying desperately to resolve my tight chest,headaches and breathing problems!  
X rays all OK,bloods OK,blood pressure slightly raised(which were expected as I were on meds for this anyway)  
Beginning of last week,were admitted again to hospital but this time were kept in for just under a week!!x 2 covid tests negative..had various professionals that treated me for cancer visit and was discharged with summary of primary hyper reactivity to smoke inhalation and secondary dyper??reactivity to smoke inhalation!!

title: Great people!
body: Had the misfortune to have to go to A & E during lockdown with chest pains. Whilst I have to say visiting any hospital for me will never be a pleasent experience the way I was looked after by all the staff from reception to all the nurses and doctors was superb. Explained everything to me, very kind and caring, a big thank you to all the staff that looked after me and put my mind at rest. You all take care in these awful times, thanks!!!

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Healthcare, Terrible Admin Staff
body: Overwhelmingly positive experience with my GP and nurses, I felt truly listened to and look after. However, interaction with the reception was often difficult, with rude and unhelpful responses. Whilst waiting for a test, watched several people go up to the desk only to be belittled and snapped at. To be clear, it wasn't that the responses were curt or insufficiently bubbly, but that they felt truly malicious and unkind.

title: Going the extra mile
body: The care my husband and I have received from the practice over the past month has been wonderful.  Both from the doctor and the receptionist.  They must be working under considerable stress given the current situation and I appreciate all they do.

title: Great Doctors can‚Äôt say the same for support‚Ä¶
body: This has been the best G P service I experienced in Torbay my Doctor was very caring and called my home when we hadn‚Äôt call the practice in his concern for me however re ordering of medicines was a different matter made difficult either on the phone or in person I no longer use this practice I miss my Doctor but I‚Äôm glad I don‚Äôt have to suffer the non medical staff

title: Fantastic, easy, online service
body: I had to leave a positive review, just been online today for my e consultation, from ringing the surgery and speaking to a receptionist that was totally caring i found the whole e booking process, simple, quick, very indepth really, and ultimately for me very much better, emailed with response very quickly and now have an appointment so, in essence, great service, long may this booking process continue obviously not the pandemic just the easy to use process, finally, thank you receptionist üòÅ

title: Professional caring staff
body:
I benefited greatly from the sessions and the instructors really cared about our progress. My injury (completely severed cruciate ligament) can be very painful, the stretching exercises help recovery times and it takes pro instruction and care to effect that. I was motivated to continue the exercises at home. I feel better stronger and healthier. Regarding the staff, always courteous and clearly passionate about what they do, after sessions we talked about correct diet and about being properly hydrated and the importance of rest and warm-ups. The instructors were helpful in promoting access to other services which led to me volunteering as a Park Ranger during ‚ÄòLockdown‚Äô


I personally got a lot from my sessions and of course it always helps having a great team to work with.

Thank you

title: Excellent Care and Compassion
body:
In 61 years I have never visited A&E for myself and today I was advised by my doctor via telephone to attend A&E to check my swollen eye.

I was preliminary checked on the way in re Covid risks and this was very thorough but they made it feel very natural.

I was seen by a lovely doctor and she took details of my condition and examined me and said she couldn't see any major problems and then within 10 minutes she asked  me to see another doctor for a second opinion and then they decided to take blood test from me.

Finally my blood test revealed my infection was localised which she originally thought,  so I was in no danger.

I feel this doctor went beyond her commitment to satisfy my safety especially in this current time.
I told her I was sorry for wasting her time and she assured me my doctor was right to send me there to get it checked out.

At no time did she make me feel unimportant infact quite the opposite and she even apologised for the length of time I was there and I was there less than 3 hours in which time 2 doctors and nurse had attended to me and a blood test was taken to pathology and results returned so I think that was incredible.

Thank you so much for your care and your unending commitment and compassion.

Please stay safe

title: Poorly written prescription
body: Writing on behalf of my elderly mum who has a diagnosis of cognitive impairment. Why write a prescription for ‚Äòone a day, tritate to TDS as tolerated‚Äô? How is she, or her family carer supposed to understand that? Lazy prescription writing and not remotely person-centred care.

title: Great practice
body: I'm extremely happy with the service, Dr.iQ is very good app it's easy to use. The doctors has responded me very fast regarding the problem.

title: Great service
body: I contacted the GP practice needing an urgent appt on a wednesday lunchtime and was contacted by the duty dr within 30 mins and booked in for an appt that afternoon. The trainee GP i saw was very through and listened to my concerns. I was followed up on the friday morning, referred for an urgent ultrasound which was booked for the saturday and called back on the monday afternoon. Such a quick, efficent response to my problem. Thank you so much

title: Words cannot describe how grateful we are
body: Our Mum is currently being treated for cancer at Castle Hill.  She was admitted last Monday with temperature and potential of covid.  The staff have been superb.  We (me and my Brother) went in yesterday (15th May) and we cannot thank the staff enough.  We met one of the nurses outside the ward and they couldn‚Äôt have been more empathetic and caring.  We were obviously emotional and asked for them to be honest.  They gave us the information we needed and showed such compassion.  We then went in to see Mum and we will be eternally grateful for the way the situation was dealt with.  The nurse then rang me last night to give us an update.  They also said how much it had given Mum a boost seeing us and it gave us even more hope and strength that Mum is fighting as much as she can.  What the NHS continue to do in its 70+ years is provide outstanding  care and that‚Äôs because of all the wonderful and amazing people who work for the nation.  We cannot thank you all enough and hope this gets through to the nurse and staff who are looking after our Mum.  We will be eternally grateful for everything.  Thank you

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great care
body: I want to praise the amazing and effective care provided to me by two GP‚Äôs and a nurse in the practice. Having been ill at home for several weeks with suspected Covid 19 the supported me through this and then insured I had outpatient checks and pursued these and arranged further checks. This led to me being admitted to hospital for a serious (non-Covid) infection and now on the road to recovery thanks to their care and diligence. I deeply grateful.

title: Coil disaster
body: I got a copper coil put in July 2019. No follow up to check. After a little while I was having dyspareunia. Long story short I was eventually referred to a gynaecologist who sent me to have an ultra sound of my womb in April 2020. Straight away the radiologist said the coil was in the wrong place. It was sitting far too low in my womb and was ineffective as contraception and likely to be cause of my dyspareuria. He suggested I get it removed/replaced asap despite corona virus effecting clinics. I had a telephone conversation with surrey sexual health services for about half an hour where she asked me all the pre appointment questions. She booked me in to buryfields for the next day and asked me to do pregnancy test in the morning as a safety measure. She explained they could only remove it due to corona (not replace it) but I would be put on a priory list when clinic returns to normal. When I arrived receptionist was very rude, I think she was on edge about corona despite the fact I was wearing mask and gloves. The telephone pre appt was to limit the amount of time I was at the clinic due to corona. I was supposed to confirm name and dob and they‚Äôd remove coil. In and out in 15 mins they said. I was still waiting 25 mins after I arrived despite being only person in waiting room. Receptionist couldn‚Äôt understand it so another doctor took my appointment. She proceeded to ask me the hundreds of questions I had already answered on phone delaying things further. I explained what happened at the ultra sound. When she examined me she said the strings hadn‚Äôt moved and I shouldn‚Äôt have it taken out. We ended up having a slight debate as I said I think the ultra sound is more accurate and I would like it out. She didn‚Äôt agree. Luckily I stood my ground and she removed it. I mentioned about the priority list to have a new one inserted once clinic had gone back to normal after corona. She looked at me as if I was stupid and said - there is no list. I asked her why the coil could have moved she patronised me again saying it hadn‚Äôt moved. Fast forward to follow up phone appointment with my gynaecologist. The first thing she said was - we need to get the coil out asap. I told her I already got it done at buryfields and she was extremely relieved. I mentioned about the strings being in place and she said it‚Äôs got nothing to do with the strings, it‚Äôs not floated off anywhere so strings are in place. The scan showed it was positioned wrong in my womb lying flat and far too low which would have definitely been causing me pain. I was so upset at how unprofessional the doctor was at buryfields. She nearly didn‚Äôt take it out despite what I told her about the scan. I honestly think you should remind doctors there that strings being in place does not mean it‚Äôs actually lying correctly in a womb. I ended up being there 45 mins putting myself and others at risk and being treated like a nuisance despite the scan showing it was an emergency.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Excellent treatment
body: Whole experience from booking first appointment to final phoned check-up was excellent.  All staff very courteous and efficient. Actual surgery done with great care, and was made to feel very comfortable throughout.  Result after surgery on both eyes was wonderful!

title: Going the extra mile
body: I am an outpatient and my GP contacted the hospital for advice on me reducing my Lithium.  The doctor at the Warneford did not just look in a book but went back through my notes and sent a detailed programme of drug reduction to my GP.  Treating me as a whole person and not just a bundle of symptoms! Thankyou

title: Excellent Care and attention
body:
I had to speak to the practice last week and had a call back from the doctor within the hour who was able to provide advice over the phone and reassurance in these difficult times. 
I always find the whole practice warm, welcoming and caring, from the girls on reception to the nursing team and all the doctors. I can‚Äôt thank you enough for all you do. Keep up all the great work.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Fantastic care recieved
body:
All the team involved in my care were extremely professional.
Having had a similar operation twice previously at two different hospital I can clearly say that the care I received at Rotherham General Hospital was the best treatment care and after care I have ever recieved. The treatment package had additional treatment that I‚Äôm certain aided and ensured my speedy recovery. The whole team involved in my care made me feel safe, cared for and confident.
I would certainly ask for Rotherham General Hospital as my chosen place for any further medical assistance in the future

title: Thanks and praise for standard of care
body: 4.5.2020 - 8.5 2020 extraordinary high standard of care prior during and post op. for fractured femur.  I would like to pass on my thanks and praise to the whole team involved with my care from Para medics, A+E. X Ray, surgical teams Physio and the entire behind the scenes teams.  Grateful thanks to you all

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Easy to use Dr iQ app
body: I recently used the Dr iQ app I downloaded onto my smart phone. Its easy to use, mainly for ordering my repeat medication. However I used it recently for an e consultation. After submitting my query I was responded to very quickly and was able to receive a telephone consultation with a GP to discuss my concern.

title: Poor service
body:
Staff are not polite, when i called to ask for test results the lady who answered the phone shouted at me that they where not important and she wouldn't let me speak to a doctor to know those results. When i managed to speak to a doctor some time later i get an apology from this doctor because the result was important for me to know and he didn't understand why I was told they where not.
I called because i have a blood test since February that needs to be done on a specific day of the month, again the lady on the phone wouldn‚Äôt let me speak to the doctor either would let me get the blood test done and was saying to go in 15 days. I can‚Äôt go in 15 days if the test has to be done on that one specific day of the month. Still she refused to let me speak to the doctor and insisted to go in 15 days.
I have only been to the GP a few times in over 3 years and every time it‚Äôs a different Doctor and they say the previous one didn‚Äôt do what needed when i went previously for the same reason.
I had a urine test and they gave me the incorrect tubes.
I have been dealing with the GP since July 2019 for the same reason and i still don‚Äôt have any answers and all i get told is ‚Äúit‚Äôs not important‚Äù ‚Äúyou are still young‚Äù. 
I am not happy at all with this.

title: Thanks to all
body:
I would like to thank all the staff for the care I received while in the hospital.  It could not have been better. 
Everyone I met was friendly, kind and caring, encouraging all the time to help me on the road to recovery

title: Fantastic access to surgery
body: Very impressed that at this difficult time I am able to speak to a clinician about my concerns. In fact she proactively rang me regarding my diabetes care. Keep it up!

title: Outstanding
body:
I consider myself extremely lucky to be a patient at Fairfield Park Health Centre as it is outstanding in every way. You are always treated with respect, kindness and understanding. The doctors treat you as an individual and always give you enough time, you are never made to feel you are bothering them unnecessarily. 
The walk in and wait sessions each weekday are fantastic as you may have to wait but you will always be seen by either a doctor or prescribing nurse. This is such a valuable service which I understand from friends that not all practices do, so I feel incredibly lucky to have this available.
I have received amazing support throughout  different difficulties with my heath and can not fault the care I have received in any way.
Even during this present Covid crisis, there hasn‚Äôt been any reduction in care for their patients, just a little different. They are all working incredibly hard to maintain the outstanding care they provide.
I would recommend this practice to anyone, the care is always ten out of ten.
A big Thank you to all of the Fairfield team, you are doing an outstanding job.

title: Disappointing Maternity Ward!
body:
It's a shame that I have to write this review as I had high hopes for this department.

Unfortunately my experience could have been improved. Firstly cleanliness is poor! Even with recent virus concerns cleaning is not priority. During my admission, of over a week my bed sheets were not changed even once. The bathroom sink or toilet wasn't cleaned the whole time. All the domestic did was run a mop over the floor every few days.

The food was of fair quality but there was limited choices especially if you have to exclude certain foods for whatever reason. Meals weren't ordered or served individually rather, you were called by staff to queue up for a poor selection of meals.

The majority of staff were unaware of my medication regime and were continually forgetting my meds, delaying and making mistakes. I had to point out many times in order to receive the current medication/doses. This is very concerning as when you're in hospital you are vulnerable and expect the staff looking after you to be on the ball.

Staff handovers could be improved, they regularly went over time, leaving patients waiting for care.

Overall the staff were professional, however some of the nurses/midwives were rude and unfriendly in their interactions with patients. From my own experience and witnessing how they communicated with others.

With nurses and health care professionals in my family, I am all too aware of the pressures that staff face in their work. 
I commend those in the profession who make sacrifices to care for others, especially in recent times.
It is disappointing and worrying when you are unwell to have a poor experience in hospital. 

I hope the department reviews it's feedback and improves it's standards.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
